I run into an issue that involves the  <index> extension point in the plugin.xml.  A inadvertently added an <index> extension in the plugin.xml that pointed to a non-exsistent file in their plugin.  This generated a error in the log.  

For a single plugin, this is fine and there no issues with the IC.  When I added 30 of their plugins into the IC, then clicked the index tab.  The errors showed up in the log, but the console also displayed a Java heap space error.  The only part of the IC that wasn't dead at this point was the TOC tab.  Both the Index and Search tabs were dead. 

<extension point="org.eclipse.help.index">
   <index file="foobar-index.xml"/>
</extension>

The follwing is displayed in the console:

I just added 5000 index entries which pointed to 5000 different nonexistent files to a plugin project and was able to open the index, with 5000 errors in the log. This is not exactly the same as having different plugins each with one index entry but it is exercising exactly the same code.

I suspect that the indexing is not causing the out of memory error but is acting like the straw that broke the camel's back by running when almost all of the heap was exhausted.

I'm going to close this as a duplicate and use Bug 205092, which is more general to track this issue. I don't believe the missing index files are the cause of the memory consumption, it's just the activity that happened to be running when the heap ran out.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 205092 ***
